description.en: The works and methodologies of A.Dundes and L.Honko will be studied from a comparative point of view, focusing both on their differences and common features. The following concepts, problems and topics will be discussed: psychoanalysis and the psychological approach, structuralism, the comparative method, variation, type, genre, fakelore, ethics.
description.et: A. Dundesi ja L.Honko töid käsitletakse võrdlevalt, tuues esile nii erinevused kui ühisjooned teadlaste vaadetes ning metodoloogias. Käsitletakse järgmisi mõisteid, probleeme ning valdkondi: psühhoanalüüs ja psühholoogiline suund, strukturalism, võrdlev meetod, varieerumine, tüüp, žanr, võltspärimus, eetika.

objectives.en: to become acquainted with the scholarly legacy two classics in folkloristics  -  Alan Dundes and Lauri Honko - and their contribution to international folkloristics.
objectives.et: saada ettekujutus folkloristika kahe klassiku – Alan Dundes’i ja Lauri Honko teaduslikust pärandist ja panusest rahvusvahelisse folkloristikasse.

learning_outcomes.en:
1)	student knows the folkloristic works of Alan Dundes and Lauri Honko
2)	is able to analyze them critically
3)	can connect them with trends in international folkloristics
learning_outcomes.et:
õppeaine läbinud üliõpilane:
1)	tunneb Alan Dundesi ja Lauri Honko rahvaluule-alaseid töid
2)	oskab neid kriitiliselt analüüsida
3)	oskab neid siduda rahvusvahelise folkloristika suundumustega

independent_work.et:
1)	Reading the required texts
2)	Giving an oral presentation in the classroom
3)	Participation in the seminar discussions
4)	Completing the written assignments

For each seminar students must write a brief synopsis of the readings (min 0.5 page, max 1 page for two articles), listing three main points/ ideas/ statements in the articles that seem significant to you.

grade_preconditions.et:
Each student must have attended at least 9 lectures/ seminars of the course. In order to redeem missed classes one has to write a comparative mini-essay on the required readings (about 1-2 pages). The mini-essay should bring out the common elements and similarities in the two articles by Dundes and Honko but also discuss the differences in their approaches. Ideally, each essay should also include a general assessment or some critical comments on the articles, and/ or suggest how these ideas could be applied in other scholarship.

In order to complete the class each student must write two mini essays (1 page each) on the following topics: 1) My disagreement(s) with Honko; 2) My disagreement(s) with Dundes; 3) How I would use Honko's ideas?; 4) How I would Dundes' ideas?
